Amazing game. One of the only games made by Valve to have actual recoil, and the only game I've ever played where I actually have to pull the gun down myself instead of having the gun go back from recoil on its own. Graphics are pretty good in my opinion, the weapons are both balanced and realistic, the overall quality of the maps and models is amazing and, lastly, it's the only game I ever played where if you don't coordinate with your team you will not succeed no matter what, while other games give the player the ability to go solo from time to time. In this game, if you try to go solo, you'll end up eating .30 caliber bullets from a deployed machine gun that no one coordinated to crush.
try this game to back it <3
es la ostia chaval a todo gas!

Even as I'm posting this, even as the Day of Defeat franchise is well past its hayday, I recommend this game.

It's a very laid-back game that lacks the seriousness and stress of other shooter games. Rather than being screamed at by your team or spending hours grinding for items (DoD:S has no collectible items), Day of Defeat: Source is the kind of game that you would play on a chill Friday night. It's just action-packed enough to make it fun, but the quick gameplay and simple mechanics also give the game a mellow vibe. Load up a game and get into a scrap with some enemies, or maybe dominate a team full of bots.

Day of Defeat: Source also doesn't feel punishing when I die. I don't look at my score of 1 kill to 7 deaths and say: "I'm having such a miserable time and I hate that my team is too incompetent to win a match!" The quick respawn times and high-damage-inducing bullets means that dying doesn't feel like I died because the other player(s) had more skill than me, but rather that I wasn't paying attention or I just so happened to be reloading when a guy walked in on the room that I was hiding in.
It's definitely worth playing this shooter game, especially if you generally aren't very competitive and are looking for a game where you don't have to worry about being steamrolled by a bunch of pay-to-play users.

Best fun war game ever! Hundreds of hours pissing about playing this and still play it and enjoy it today. It still holds up even by today's standards!

If your into war get this.!

A classic, with many custom content!

I remember the Counter-Strike: Source package that included not only Half-Life 2: Deathmatch, but Day of Defeat: Source as well. Eerie to remember the soundtrack that played when you first booted up the game.  Choosing a character and then spawning inside your base.  Capturing countless points and firing into a cloud of smoke.  Hoping to see a kill pop-up on the kill feed.  

Great game overall :D
Jogo da hora muito leve muito adrenalina kk
good game sad game 10/10 IGN would play again

A timeless classic.

I feel it is a step backwards from the original Day of Defeat. However, the game play is decent enough to make me overlook that flaw.

I tried re-installing the game recently to play a few rounds but it seems the game is all but abandoned now. Very few people play DoD: Source. A shame seeing as it is a very enjoyable game if you get into a good server.

7/10

fun with friends but almost completely dead. it was great back in its day but not really anymore. the few still lively servers are dominated by unfriendly addicts to the game and server owners with a lot of strange and honestly upsetting rules. not worth it.

example:

"Don't throw smoke grenades in spawn!!!!!!!!!!!"

- me: "I am doing it so i stop getting shot as soon as i spawn"

"I don't care it's against the rules!"

then they force open the rules to me and that's when i'm like "okay i'm done"
